entry.title: Week 40, 2025: OCaml 5.4.0 RC1 released, cmdliner 2.0.0 migration completed, MirageOS ecosystem updates, and 43 packages merged
entry.content:
Summary

cmdliner 2.0.0 ecosystem migration, MirageOS releases (4.9.0, 4.10.0, 4.10.1), Lwt 6 compatibility updates, MSys2 infrastructure

Activity

  • cmdliner 2.0.0 migration completed with multiple compatibility fixes including upper bounds by @mserpi on ocamlformat (#28651), constraint revisions on alcotest by Hannes Mehnert (#28635), and constraint additions by Daniel Bünzli on mirage-runtime and direct failures (#28607, #28606, #28603)
  • MirageOS core releases across multiple versions: 4.9.0, 4.10.0, and 4.10.1 by Hannes Mehnert showing active unikernel platform development (#27551, #28464, #28481)
  • Lwt 6 compatibility work by Raphaël Proust adding incompatibility constraints for packages using deprecated APIs (Lwtunix.makenotification, runinmain, enteriterhooks) affecting usb, bimage-lwt, fuseau-lwt, and fixing lwt_log bounds (#28641)
  • MSys2 infrastructure improvements with symlink handling in GitHub Actions by Jan Midtgaard and updates to opam library patch version requirements (#28614, #28613)
  • MirageOS ecosystem updates including dkim-mirage dns-client upper bound by Hannes Mehnert (#27431)
  • runtimeeventstools 0.5.3 release across 2 packages for OCaml runtime monitoring (#28452)
  • forester package updates with constraint modifications across 11 versions (#28641)
  • ocamlformat versions 0.20.0 through 0.26.2 received cmdliner upper bounds affecting 9 package versions (#28651)
  • ocluster versions 0.1 through 0.3.0 received constraint updates across 4 package versions
entry.summary: OCaml 5.4.0 RC1 released, cmdliner 2.0.0 migration completed, MirageOS ecosystem updates, and 43 packages merged

entry.title: Week 39, 2025: Major cmdliner 2.0.0 release coordination with ecosystem-wide compatibility updates plus numerous package releases
entry.content:
Summary

Heavy package release activity with 20+ new versions plus ongoing cmdliner compatibility work

Activity

  • Major new packages opened this week include postgresql 5.3.2 by Markus Mottl (#28605), uring 2.7.0 by Anil Madhavapeddy (#28604), and moonpool 0.9 by Simon Cruanes (#28597)
  • Cmdliner 2.0.0 ecosystem coordination dominated the week with Daniel Bünzli leading release preparation (#28599), Kate handling opam tooling constraints (#28601), and Mark Elvers providing follow-up fixes (#28603)
  • Network stack releases delivered by Hannes Mehnert with TLS 2.0.3 (#28590) and DNS 10.2.1 (#28582) plus related security improvements
  • Static site generation advancement with YoCaml 2.6.0 release including 13 packages by Xavier Van de Woestyne (#28571)
  • Infrastructure improvements by Jan Midtgaard adding Windows MSys2 CI workflow (#28598) and MinGW package support (#28585)
  • System programming releases from Calascibetta Romain with Solo5 0.9.3 (#28570) and progress 0.5.0 (#28569)
entry.summary: Major cmdliner 2.0.0 release coordination with ecosystem-wide compatibility updates plus numerous package releases

entry.title: Week 38, 2025: New package releases with CI infrastructure fixes and extensive lwt6 compatibility updates across the ecosystem
entry.content:
Summary

CI infrastructure crisis resolved, multiple new packages opened, and extensive package maintenance work completed

Activity

  • Critical CI infrastructure issue resolved with conf-gmp.1 marked as avoid version by Raphaël Proust to address GCC 14 compatibility problems (#28540, #28541)
  • New packages opened this week including zanuda linter 2.0.0 with OCaml 5.3 support by Dmitrii Kosarev (#28537), portmidi 0.4 MIDI bindings by Michael Bacarella (#28531), and dune upper bound constraints for tezt by Jan Midtgaard (#28550)
  • Multiple package releases merged including coq-lsp versions for OCaml 8.20, 9.0, and 9.1 (#28532, #28533, #28534), iomux 0.4 with macOS fixes by Anil Madhavapeddy (#28535), and elpi 3.4.0 lambda prolog interpreter (#28536)
  • Package maintenance work including typo fixes in archiving documentation by Jean-Christophe Léchenet (#28546) and ongoing smtml package testing by @filipeom (#28526)
entry.summary: New package releases with CI infrastructure fixes and extensive lwt6 compatibility updates across the ecosystem

entry.title: Week 37, 2025: Heavy Windows/MinGW cross-platform support improvements by Jan Midtgaard with 36 package merges and 63 new PRs
entry.content:
Summary

Major Windows platform improvements, new package releases, and ongoing OCaml 5.4.0 ecosystem preparation work

Activity

  • New package releases opened include why3.1.8.2 formal verification platform by Claude Marché (#28511), ocaml-protoc-plugin 6.2.0 Protocol Buffer support by Anders Peter Fugmann (#28412), and comprehensive chess library updates for chesscomapi and lichess_api (#28521)
  • Windows development ecosystem received comprehensive MinGW support through Jan Midtgaard's merged PRs adding native Windows compilation for graphics libraries: freetype (#28515), cairo with Cygwin fixes (#28514), SDL2 components including sdl2-net (#28513), sdl2-mixer (#28512), sdl2-ttf (#28510), and SDL2_image (#28507)
  • Package maintenance featured crs.0.0.20250914 code review tool with OCaml 5.4.0 compatibility (#28522), proton.1.0.15 high-performance database driver (#28518), vsrocq-language-server.2.3.0 LSP support (#28501), and educational coq-waterproof.3.0.0 releases for multiple Coq versions (#28500, #28498)
  • Dependency management improvements addressed lwt_ppx upper bounds for dream alpha releases (#28520), comprehensive LWT 6.0 compatibility constraints across ecosystem packages (#28482), and critical Tezos checksum corrections for rust-libs versions (#28491)
entry.summary: Heavy Windows/MinGW cross-platform support improvements by Jan Midtgaard with 36 package merges and 63 new PRs

entry.title: Week 36, 2025: Productive week with 28 merged PRs, new package releases, and infrastructure improvements across multiple domains
entry.content:
Summary

Package maintenance focus with opam-build updates, compiler compatibility fixes, and ongoing discussions around Windows toolchain support

Activity

  • New packages opened this week including system-cygwin support request by Ali Caglayan (#28415), ocaml-system support for 5.4.0/5.5.0 by Kate (#28455), and cudd bindings by @yarukha (#28422)
  • Package maintenance updates with opam-build/opam-test 0.2.6 by Kate (#28454), runtimeeventstools 0.5.3 by Tim McGilchrist (#28452), and tinyfiledialogs bindings by Charles Averill (#28456)
  • Dune ecosystem activity with version 3.20.2 merged by Etienne fixing jsofocaml compilation and cram test issues (#28437)
  • Chess and gaming libraries updated by Boris Novoselov with chesscomapi, lichessapi, and pgnparser 1.0.1 (#28416)
  • Protocol and networking improvements with liquidsoap 2.4.0 by Romain Beauxis (#28429) and multiple MirageOS component updates
  • Static site generation progress with YOCaml 2.4.1 by Xavier Van de Woestyne adding TOC traversal and markdown package reintroduction (#28430)
  • Version control tooling enhanced with volgo 0.0.21 by Mathieu Barbin improving git operations and bit vector handling (#28410)
entry.summary: Productive week with 28 merged PRs, new package releases, and infrastructure improvements across multiple domains

entry.title: Week 35, 2025: Active week with 31 merged PRs including major Dune 3.20.1 update, Windows support enhancements, and new SMT solver packages
entry.content:
Summary

Strong package maintenance activity with 31 merged PRs covering core infrastructure updates, new gaming-related packages, and ecosystem improvements

Activity

  • Three PRs opened this week for major upcoming releases including ocaml-protoc-plugin 6.2.0 protocol buffer improvements (#28412), cvc5 SMT solver bindings (#28419), and deadcodeanalyzer tool (#28417)
  • Core infrastructure updates delivered through Etienne merging Dune 3.20.1 across 15 packages (#28397), Kate updating GitHub API libraries to 4.5.0 (#28390), and Raphaël Proust improving Lwt async libraries (#28384)
  • Mirage ecosystem maintenance by Hannes Mehnert across five PRs including mirage-crypto 2.0.2 security updates (#28382), protocol-9p 2.1.0 compatibility (#28394), hvsock 3.1.0 Hyper-V improvements (#28393), and mirage-mtime 5.1.0 clock enhancements (#28392)
  • Windows platform support expansion by Jan Midtgaard through seven merged PRs covering GTK library support (#28387, #28389), dependency bound fixes (#28400, #28371, #28372), and URL corrections (#28407)
  • Gaming and multimedia packages including chess development tools (#28404), FFmpeg bindings update to 1.2.6 (#28401), and audio file format support (#28418)
  • Formal verification ecosystem growth with smtml solver frontend improvements (#28399), Ortac 0.7.2 specification testing updates (#28403), and Coq-waterproof educational packages (#28402, #28405)
entry.summary: Active week with 31 merged PRs including major Dune 3.20.1 update, Windows support enhancements, and new SMT solver packages

entry.title: Week 34, 2025: Active week with major package releases including Dune 3.20.0, TLS 2.0.2, and enhanced Windows platform support
entry.content:
Summary

22 package releases merged with focus on MirageOS ecosystem, cryptography, and build tools

Activity

  • New package releases dominated activity with Hannes Mehnert delivering MirageOS ecosystem updates including hvsock 3.1.0 (#28393), protocol-9p 2.1.0 (#28394), mirage-crypto 2.0.2 (#28382), mirage-mtime 5.1.0 (#28392), albatross 2.5.1 (#28369), and mirage-net-xen 2.1.6 (#28349)
  • Cross-platform compatibility enhanced by Jan Midtgaard with comprehensive Windows support for GUI libraries including conf-gtk2 (#28387), conf-gtk3 (#28389), and libao (#28376), plus dependency maintenance work fixing pgquery bounds (#28372), ppxrapper compatibility (#28371, #28370), OCaml 5.3 support (#28364), and opam-compiler bounds (#28375)
  • Build system advancement with Etienne releasing Dune 3.20.0 across 15 packages (#28357) providing improved compilation and project management capabilities
  • Academic and research tools updated with François Pottier releasing unionFind.20250818 (#28350), Lukasz Stafiniak publishing ocannl 0.6.0 (#28367) and cudajit 0.7.2 (#28363), and Paul-Elliot Anglès d'Auriac releasing slipshow 0.6.0 (#28351)
  • Infrastructure improvements included Sora Morimoto setting up Dependabot automation (#28361), Kate improving Alpine Linux ninja support (#28365), and Florent Monnier updating maintainer contacts (#28356, #28320)
  • Package ecosystem expansion with multiple contributors adding new libraries including @arutonee1 publishing tacit 1.0.0 (#28355), Stephen Sherratt releasing climate 0.8.2 (#28366), Shreya Pawaskar adding claudius (#28359), and Mark Elvers updating dockerfile packages (#28358)
entry.summary: Active week with major package releases including Dune 3.20.0, TLS 2.0.2, and enhanced Windows platform support

entry.title: Week 33, 2025: Active week with 25 package releases and 23 new PRs opened, including new frameworks and library updates.
entry.content:
Summary

Package maintenance and ecosystem updates with certificate updates, build system fixes, and dependency constraint improvements.

Activity

  • Package submissions include TUI framework Mosaic by Thibaut Mattio (#28326) and web framework Catala still under review (#28280)
  • Infrastructure improvements with repository archive mirror configuration by Kate (#28348) awaiting external dependencies
  • Certificate updates through ca-certs-nss 3.115 by Hannes Mehnert (#28346)
  • Build system fixes for bad checksums in osh and opam-custom-install packages by Jan Midtgaard (#28332)
  • Dependency constraint fixes for hxd package compatibility across OCaml versions (#28337)
  • Package updates include bitwuzla-cxx SMT solver, unisimarchisec decoder, and ppxinteract REPL extension (#28335, #28334, #28321)
entry.summary: Active week with 25 package releases and 23 new PRs opened, including new frameworks and library updates.

entry.title: Week 32, 2025: Active week with 35 new PRs including major releases like Dune 3.20.0~alpha3, new HTTP libraries, and extensive compatibility updates
entry.content:
Summary

Heavy package maintenance activity with compatibility fixes, new library releases, and ecosystem updates across HTTP, build tools, and language implementations

Activity

  • New package additions this week including Calascibetta Romain introducing httpcats HTTP client (#28322), Paul-Elliot Anglès d'Auriac releasing slipshow presentation tool (#28308), and Enrico Tassi updating elpi interpreter (#28316)
  • Build system improvements with Etienne delivering Dune 3.20.0~alpha3 featuring enhanced testing aliases, OS detection variables, and improved concurrent execution (#28302)
  • Language tooling updates including Guido Martínez releasing F* 2025.08.07 (#28315), Darius Foo updating ppx_interact for OCaml 5.2 compatibility (#28321)
  • Extensive compatibility maintenance by Marcello Seri fixing stdcompat 21.0 compatibility across clangml and pyml packages, plus resolving doi2bib update (#28313, #28309, multiple clangml/pyml fixes)
  • HTTP ecosystem development with Calascibetta Romain contributing h1 library updates, httpcats client, and related networking improvements (#28304, #28322)
  • Python integration improvements through Sébastien Hinderer releasing pyml 20250807 and metaquot 0.6.0 with enhanced OCaml 5.2+ support (#28314, #28318)
  • Package maintenance fixes including Florent Monnier updating ocaml-sdl2 maintainer contact information (#28320) and Marcello Seri adding stdcompat 21.0 release (#28305)
entry.summary: Active week with 35 new PRs including major releases like Dune 3.20.0~alpha3, new HTTP libraries, and extensive compatibility updates

entry.title: Week 31, 2025: Multiple new package releases including DNS 10.2.0 ecosystem update, new Anthropic API bindings, and Alpine Linux compatibility fixes
entry.content:
Summary

New Catala 1.0.0-alpha PR opened; multiple package compatibility fixes and version constraint updates

Activity

  • New PR opened for Catala 1.0.0-alpha literate programming language for tax code specification by Denis Merigoux, awaiting dependency fixes (#28280)
  • Package compatibility fixes including memtrace.0.1 marked incompatible with OCaml 5, qcheck-lin.0.8 marked incompatible with trunk/OCaml 5.5, and dream upper bounds set for dream-httpaf (8a888d8, c317d1f)
  • Dream ecosystem updates with dream-html 3.11.1 and pure-html 3.11.1 releases (ee8b919)
  • OCaml ecosystem maintenance including down 0.4.0 text processing library, bytesrw 0.2.0, cf_workers 0.1.5, and utop 2.16.0 REPL improvements (719c9f8)
entry.summary: Multiple new package releases including DNS 10.2.0 ecosystem update, new Anthropic API bindings, and Alpine Linux compatibility fixes

entry.title: Week 30, 2025: OCaml 5.4.0 beta, opam 2.4.1 release, and 40+ package updates including Eio 1.3 and Lwt 6.0.0 alpha
entry.content:
Summary

Major package releases, extensive bound fixes across 100+ packages, and new library submissions

Activity

  • Lwt 6.0.0 alpha01 opened by Raphaël Proust with breaking changes for modernization, awaiting upper bound constraints (#28222)
  • Package bound fixes completed across the ecosystem with missing v prefixes corrected in over 100 package dependencies including apron, ppxinlinetest, and zarithstubsjs packages
  • New package releases delivered including ca-certs-nss 3.114, dream-html 3.11.1, gmp 6.3.0, memfd 0.1.0, pcre 8.0.5, solo5 0.9.2, and wayland 2.2
  • Cross-platform support enhanced with OpenSUSE compatibility added to conf-gmp-paths and conf-mpfr-paths configuration packages
  • Documentation and tooling updated with ocp-browser 1.4.0, print-table 0.1.0, and slipshow 0.4.1 presentation tool
  • Library ecosystem expanded with bytesrw 0.2.0, fmt 0.11.0, htmlit 0.2.0, jsont 0.2.0, and various specialized packages
entry.summary: OCaml 5.4.0 beta, opam 2.4.1 release, and 40+ package updates including Eio 1.3 and Lwt 6.0.0 alpha

entry.title: Week 29, 2025: Active week with numerous package releases including opam 2.4.0, eio 1.3, and odoc 3.1.0, plus repository maintenance discussions
entry.content:
Summary

Five community issues discussing package maintenance, repository transfers, and build dependencies were actively resolved

Activity

  • Repository ownership transfer guidance provided by Anil Madhavapeddy to Mathieu Barbin for safe package repository migration using GitHub redirects (#28189)
  • Package update policy discussion by @cctv130 regarding OCaml version compatibility and upstream maintenance strategy (#28202)
  • Build dependency resolution for radare2 package requirement affecting bap installation on Ubuntu systems (#28188)
entry.summary: Active week with numerous package releases including opam 2.4.0, eio 1.3, and odoc 3.1.0, plus repository maintenance discussions

entry.title: Week 28, 2025: Major week with 9 new packages, QCheck 0.26 release, js_of_ocaml 6.1.1 update, and extensive dependency bound fixes
entry.content:
Summary

Extensive dependency bound maintenance affecting containers, goblint, and prbnmcn-stats packages plus platform compatibility fixes

Activity

  • QCheck compatibility updates by Jan Midtgaard adding upper bounds for qcheck-core across multiple packages including containers 3.7-3.16 (b5e7ab9), goblint 2.0.0-2.5.0 (56ff4ee, e288c65), and prbnmcn-stats 0.0.2-0.0.8 (dbb6770)
  • Platform compatibility fixes by Yishuai Li including OCaml version constraints for camlimages 5.0.5 (fe6ca86), macOS availability fixes for freetds 0.7 (fd85e73), and base package patches for v0.14.3 and v0.15.1 (072772f)
  • Additional package updates including logs-async compatibility (96cb4bc), Frama-C lannotate and luncov 0.2.4 releases (22035717), and gettext 0.4.2 fileutils compatibility fix (072772f)
  • Configuration packages additions including conf-gegl and conf-taglib_c support (df0c9cc)
entry.summary: Major week with 9 new packages, QCheck 0.26 release, js_of_ocaml 6.1.1 update, and extensive dependency bound fixes

entry.title: Week 27, 2025: Major package releases including OPAM 2.4.0-rc1, js_of_ocaml 6.1.0, and new alpha releases for raven ecosystem packages
entry.content:
Summary

Active discussion on package versioning policy and maintenance timeline sparked by Rocq Platform requirements

Activity

  • OPAM 2.4.0-rc1 ecosystem release delivered comprehensive update with 8 core packages including opam-client, opam-core, opam-format, opam-solver, and opam-state providing release candidate functionality for testing
  • jsofocaml 6.1.0 major release brought updated compiler, lwt integration, ppx extensions, toplevel support, tyxml integration, and new WebAssembly compiler capabilities across 8 coordinated packages
  • Data science ecosystem expansion through raven 1.0.0~alpha0 suite introducing 9 alpha packages for data analysis including nx (core), nx-datasets, nx-text, hugin, kaun, quill, rune, and sowilo for comprehensive data processing workflows
  • Testing framework advancement with Ortac 0.7.0 delivering updated property-based testing capabilities through 6 packages covering core functionality, dune integration, QCheck STM support, and runtime libraries
  • OCaml 5.3.0 compatibility maintenance addressing compatibility constraints across multiple packages including cohttp-async updates, dune 3.15.3 upper bound fixes, genjsapi compatibility patches, and jsoo-react ppxlib constraint updates
  • Security and cryptography updates including binsec 0.10.1 binary analysis platform release, jasmin 2025.06.0 cryptographic compiler update, and ca-certs-nss 3.113.1 certificate bundle refresh
entry.summary: Major package releases including OPAM 2.4.0-rc1, js_of_ocaml 6.1.0, and new alpha releases for raven ecosystem packages

entry.title: Week 26, 2025: Major package releases and policy discussions, with 119 files changed across multiple new package versions and compatibility updates.
entry.content:
Summary

Three repository issues addressing package archival policies, GCC 14 compatibility, and Merlin version availability.

Activity

  • Package archival policy discussion initiated by Ralf Jung regarding automatic removal of old Dune versions affecting CI systems, with Hannes Mehnert coordinating restoration efforts and policy improvements (#28065)
  • GCC 14 build compatibility issue resolved by Jason Conroy and Marcello Seri addressing incompatible-pointer-types errors in plplot package (#28095)
  • Merlin version confusion quickly resolved by Mohamed Hernouf with guidance from Hannes Mehnert regarding OCaml 4.14 compatibility (#28075)
entry.summary: Major package releases and policy discussions, with 119 files changed across multiple new package versions and compatibility updates.

entry.title: Week 25, 2025: Major maintenance work with hundreds of package versions removed and multiple new releases
entry.content:
Summary

Extensive maintenance work removing hundreds of older package versions, plus Windows CI infrastructure issue

Activity

  • Repository maintenance involved removing thousands of older package versions across many packages including alcotest, cohttp, charrua, conduit, capnp-rpc, and many others to clean up the package archive
  • Metrics library constraint updates affecting albatross and builder-web to restrict to metrics < 0.5.0 (f8fdcf3)
  • Package constraint updates including ppxlib upper bound changes and dune version updates across multiple packages
  • Windows CI infrastructure broken with rsync errors reported by Marcello Seri (#28062)
entry.summary: Major maintenance work with hundreds of package versions removed and multiple new releases

entry.title: Week 24, 2025: Major package releases including Dune 3.19.1, Base v0.17.3, OCaml-Unikraft 1.0.0, Sail 0.19.1, and deprecation of duppy/dtools packages
entry.content:
Summary

Package maintenance with CI improvements, Windows build fixes, dependency constraints, and ecosystem coordination efforts

Activity

  • Windows CI infrastructure resolved by Jan Midtgaard reporting cache issues affecting MinGW builds (#28007) and Puneeth Chaganti implementing fixes (#28011, #28016)
  • Package dependency management including upper bounds additions for boltzgen.0.9 and ppxx.2.5.0 due to ocaml-compiler-libs breaking changes tracked by Shon Feder (#28023)
  • Cross-platform builds enhanced through Windows/Cygwin configuration fixes in multiple conf packages and availability restrictions (#28011)
  • OCaml 5.3 MSVC compatibility investigation by Ali Caglayan addressing build detection conflicts (#28005)
  • Repository documentation improvements planned with Shon Feder proposing wiki migration to main repository for better collaboration (#28022)
  • Issue cleanup maintenance by Hannes Mehnert closing several legacy build issues and duplicates (#24761, #27539, #22147, #21593, #25933)
entry.summary: Major package releases including Dune 3.19.1, Base v0.17.3, OCaml-Unikraft 1.0.0, Sail 0.19.1, and deprecation of duppy/dtools packages

entry.title: Week 23, 2025: Extensive package ecosystem expansion with 12+ new releases including yojson 3.0.0, coq-lsp multi-version release, and maintenance updates
entry.content:
Summary

Major maintenance wave affecting 171 packages with dependency updates, platform fixes, and repository maintenance

Activity

  • Extensive dependency maintenance across multiple package families including atdgen (17 versions updated), lsp/ocaml-lsp-server (40+ versions), kind2 (13 versions), goblint (7 versions), and pa_ppx (10 versions) for consistency and compatibility
  • Platform compatibility improvements including conf-clang-format Alpine 22 support (160af9d), conf-freeglut msys2 typo fix (3666d7b), and conf-gnuplot Windows/OpenBSD support (1f3312b)
  • Package availability updates for OCaml 5.4 compatibility fixes (eb0953b) and upper bound adjustments (199664c)
  • Repository infrastructure improvements with download mirror URLs added for ocamlfind (883026b), source archive URLs for ocamlnet-4.1.9 (056e15c)
  • Quality assurance through test disabling for specific packages where needed (eed6bcc)
entry.summary: Extensive package ecosystem expansion with 12+ new releases including yojson 3.0.0, coq-lsp multi-version release, and maintenance updates

entry.title: Week 22, 2025: New package releases including YOCaml 2.3.0 static site generator, LWD UI library 0.4, LLVM 19 bindings, and bug fixes for bin_prot build issues
entry.content:
Summary

Package maintenance focused on OCaml 5.4 compatibility, dependency fixes, and ecosystem updates across 119 files

Activity

  • OCaml 5.4 readiness tracked in ongoing coordination issue by Florian Angeletti covering platform tools including opam, dune, merlin, LSP server, and odoc (#27916)
  • bin_prot compilation fixes resolved long-standing build failures on OpenSUSE and FreeBSD by Hannes Mehnert addressing linker and script execution issues (#26005, #27646)
  • Dependency constraint updates including ppxminidebug compatibility fixes with ppxsexp_conv, lsp package csexp bounds correction, and cca package mirage-mtime conflict resolution (dependency-fixes)
  • Package ecosystem expansion with 12 new YOCaml modules for static site generation, trace library 0.10 for performance monitoring, and various utility packages including pageantty for SSH agent interaction (ecosystem-growth)
entry.summary: New package releases including YOCaml 2.3.0 static site generator, LWD UI library 0.4, LLVM 19 bindings, and bug fixes for bin_prot build issues

entry.title: Week 21, 2025: OCaml 5.4.0 alpha1 packages introduced with cross-platform configuration improvements and ecosystem updates
entry.content:
Summary

Major package releases for Dune 3.19.0, DNS 10.1.0, and YOCaml 2.3.0 with 50+ package updates

Activity

  • Dune 3.19.0 release delivered by Etienne with 15 packages including build system, configurator, and RPC components (f85c940)
  • DNS ecosystem update to version 10.1.0 by Hannes Mehnert spanning 13 packages for client, server, and security components (10ad3ee)
  • YOCaml static site generator updated to 2.3.0 with 12 packages for markdown processing and site generation (efe095a)
  • MlFront tool suite version 2.3.1 added by @jonahbeckford with 9 packages for cache, CLI, and configuration management (92e1b8b)
  • Package infrastructure improvements including widespread os-family standardization affecting 300+ configuration packages for better platform detection
entry.summary: OCaml 5.4.0 alpha1 packages introduced with cross-platform configuration improvements and ecosystem updates

entry.title: Week 20, 2025: Active week with 20+ new package releases including cryptographic, tooling, and development libraries
entry.content:
Summary

Two new PRs opened with portmidi bindings and MetaOCaml platform support plus ongoing magick-core configuration work

Activity

  • New library submission portmidi 0.4 bindings by Michael Bacarella with libportmidi integration and Pt_Time function support opened but encountering compilation issues (#27877)
  • Platform compatibility lift MacOS arm64 restriction for MetaOCaml 5.3.0+BER by Jeremy Yallop with CI testing and platform verification ongoing (#27887)
  • Configuration improvements dual conf-files for magick-core versions 6 and 7 by Florent Monnier addressing Debian 12 compatibility issues continues from previous weeks (#27798)
  • MariaDB Windows fix completed by Raphaël Proust resolving pkg-config path issues on Windows platform merged successfully (#27865)
entry.summary: Active week with 20+ new package releases including cryptographic, tooling, and development libraries

entry.title: Week 19, 2025: Active week with new package releases, conf-mariadb fix merged, and ongoing magick-core configuration work
entry.content:
Summary

One new PR opened for magick-core configuration, one conf-mariadb fix merged, and extensive package release activity

Activity

  • New PR opened by Florent Monnier proposing separate conf-files for magick-core library versions 6 and 7 to address Debian 12 compatibility (#27798)
  • conf-mariadb.2 fix merged by Raphaël Proust addressing Windows pkg-config errors in CI builds (#27865)
  • Package release activity included smtml.0.7.0 SMT solver library, metal.0.1.0 embedded systems package, fungi.0.1.4 networking library, spurs.0.1.0 data processing tools, and dune-deps.1.5.0 build system utilities
  • Tool ecosystem updates with junit testing framework 2.3.0, alt-ergo theorem prover 2.6.2, ocamlformat-mlx 0.27.0, and dypgen parser generator 0.2.1
  • CI and infrastructure improvements including core_unix availability fixes and opam-ci pedantic linting updates
entry.summary: Active week with new package releases, conf-mariadb fix merged, and ongoing magick-core configuration work

entry.title: Week 18, 2025: Active week with 25+ new package releases including Dune 3.18.2, major infrastructure improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Focused on ecosystem maintenance with 25+ package releases and infrastructure improvements

Activity

  • Major build system update with Etienne releasing Dune 3.18.2 comprehensive package suite including core build system, action plugin, configurator, glob patterns, RPC components, site integration, and development utilities (#27838)
  • Cryptographic and security enhancements by Calascibetta Romain with DKIM email authentication library 0.8.0 supporting Unix, LWT, and Mirage implementations (#27831), USPF Sender Policy Framework 0.1.0 (#27832), and LWT double-linked list data structure 1.1.0 (#27829)
  • Performance and data structure libraries including dynamic garbage collection tuning by Nat Mote (#27818), fast bit vector operations by Stefan Muenzel (#27834), float option utilities (#27819), and string manipulation with bstr 0.0.1 (#27828)
  • Web and application frameworks with @sam-huckaby releasing Savvy web framework 0.2.0 (#27822), Dream Inertia integration for SPA development (588f313), and Javier Chávarri updating NPM dependency checker 4.0.0 (#27797)
  • System integration improvements with Hannes Mehnert updating AWA SSH library 0.5.1 (#27815), @astrada adding OCamlFUSE 2.7.1-cvs13 filesystem integration (#27840), and Romain Beauxis enhancing POSIX bindings and socket support (#27800)
  • Development tools and utilities with François Pottier releasing Fix library 20250428 for constraint solving (#27825), @filipeom updating Flow parser 0.268.0 (#27804), Koon Wen Lee adding PPX JSON schema derivation 0.0.4 (#27843), and Mathieu Barbin contributing pplumbing utilities 0.0.11 (#27826)
  • Infrastructure maintenance by Kate with Alt Linux distribution support improvements (#27809) and patch library 3.0.0~alpha2 release (#27842), plus Marek Kubica enhancing command detection utilities (#27812)
entry.summary: Active week with 25+ new package releases including Dune 3.18.2, major infrastructure improvements

entry.title: Week 17, 2025: Package releases and system configuration updates with new virtual packages for multimedia libraries
entry.content:
Summary

Package releases for web frameworks, HTTP servers, and build tools with multiple contributor submissions

Activity

  • Package releases included Simon Cruanes publishing tiny_httpd 0.18 and 0.19 with companion camlzip packages (#27745, #27786)
  • Web framework updates by Yawar Amin releasing dream-html 3.10.1 and pure-html 3.10.1 packages (#27801)
  • Build tooling enhanced with Kate releasing opam-publish 2.5.1 (#27795)
  • Audio library support expanded by Gabriel Santamaria adding virtual packages for multimedia dependencies (#27792, #27794)
  • Float library updated with float_option 0.0.2 release including version constraint fixes
entry.summary: Package releases and system configuration updates with new virtual packages for multimedia libraries

entry.title: Week 16, 2025: Major week with 100+ new package releases including Dune 3.18.1, Alt-Ergo 2.6.1, OpenBLAS fixes, and opam 2.4 alpha packages
entry.content:
Summary

New PR opened for ImageMagick Core library compatibility, plus community maintainer recruitment and documentation enhancement discussions

Activity

  • New PR opened by Florent Monnier for ImageMagick Core library version 6/7 compatibility providing separate conf-files for different major versions (#27798)
  • Maintainer recruitment drive by Shon Feder attracting 13+ volunteers interested in supporting the opam-repository ecosystem (#27740)
  • Documentation enhancement proposal by Shon Feder to add clear explanations about opam-repository curation and CI processes in README (#27796)
entry.summary: Major week with 100+ new package releases including Dune 3.18.1, Alt-Ergo 2.6.1, OpenBLAS fixes, and opam 2.4 alpha packages

entry.title: Week 15, 2025: Significant package repository expansion with 38 package updates across multiple ecosystem domains
entry.content:
Summary

Extensive package release activity with 35 new package versions spanning audio/video processing, machine learning, testing frameworks, and language tools

Activity

  • New package releases included major version updates across diverse domains: FFmpeg audio/video processing suite (8 packages at 1.2.3), machine learning tools (arrayjit 0.5.2, neuralnetslib 0.5.2, cudajit 0.7.0), testing frameworks (qcheck suite 0.8, domainslib 0.5.2), and language tools (jasmin 2025.02.1, pratter 5.0.1)
  • Standard library and compatibility updates with stdcompat releasing versions 20.0 and 20.1, base package updating to v0.16.4, and subprocess utility reaching 0.2.1
  • Development tool enhancements including trace framework updates (4 packages at 0.9.1), linol language server library (3 packages at 0.9), and conan framework expansion (5 packages at 0.0.6)
  • Package maintenance work involved compatibility constraints for Alpine Linux distributions, OCaml version limitations, and build system configuration updates across multiple core packages
entry.summary: Significant package repository expansion with 38 package updates across multiple ecosystem domains

entry.title: Week 14, 2025: Week focused on package releases with major version updates for Dune 3.18.0, Caqti 2.2.4, and Liquidsoap 2.3.2
entry.content:
Summary

One ongoing PR for Pds library update and multiple compiler compatibility issues reported

Activity

  • Ongoing PR by @orbitz updating Pds library to version 6.55 with reviewer feedback being addressed (#27694)
  • Package ecosystem expansion with 57 new package files added including significant releases like diffast 0.2 diff tool, smtml 0.6.2 SMT solver, and ppx_minidebug 2.2.0 debugging preprocessor
  • Infrastructure maintenance with GitHub Actions workflow updates for Windows builds and license additions for existing packages
entry.summary: Week focused on package releases with major version updates for Dune 3.18.0, Caqti 2.2.4, and Liquidsoap 2.3.2

entry.title: Week 13, 2025: Exceptionally active week with 64 new package releases, including major Diffast 0.2 toolkit and YoCaml 2.2.0 static site generator
entry.content:
Summary

One new PR opened for Pds package update, with one fswatch release successfully merged after review discussions about dependency configuration

Activity

  • New PR opened for Pds 6.55 update by @orbitz addressing test failures from previous attempt (#27694)
  • FSWatch release merged by ZAN DoYe with compatibility for fswatch 1.18 and removal of extra-thread workarounds, though maintainer Marcello Seri noted potential conf package issues on Debian-based systems (#27665)
  • Package stability improvements with bulk updates to Jane Street packages and Coq ecosystem packages pointing to checksum-stable tarballs by Matthieu Sozeau for better reproducibility (ab1fe1c)
  • Build system fixes including ARM32 support for Core and dependencies by @46648c7, FreeBSD and Alpine Linux compatibility improvements with GNU diff requirements (b2123899)
entry.summary: Exceptionally active week with 64 new package releases, including major Diffast 0.2 toolkit and YoCaml 2.2.0 static site generator

entry.title: Week 12, 2025: Heavy package submission week with major releases including Melange 5.1.0, Rocq 9.0.0, odoc 3.0.0, and alcotest 1.9.0
entry.content:
Summary

Extensive package maintenance with conf-gmp pkg-config improvements, alt-ergo cmdliner compatibility, and ppxlib upper bounds

Activity

  • Platform compatibility fixes including conf-gmp pkg-config integration (eeae51c), OpenBSD build patches (e0d2788), and SUSE Linux support (d13c719)
  • Dependency management with alt-ergo marked incompatible with cmdliner 2.0 (2f73a14) and comprehensive ppxlib 0.36.0 upper bounds additions (001da76)
  • Build system improvements including Coq 9.0 reverse dependency fixes (d8ecf80) and VSCoq language server constraint relaxation (79d4823)
  • Package additions covering diverse functionality: caldav 0.2.4 calendar support (16df1de), mkaudio 1.1.4 audio processing (1a8bbb0), and dreammiddlewareext 0.1.0 web framework extensions (b4f3ba8)
entry.summary: Heavy package submission week with major releases including Melange 5.1.0, Rocq 9.0.0, odoc 3.0.0, and alcotest 1.9.0

entry.title: Week 11, 2025: Maintenance week with new package releases, dependency constraint updates, and repository cleanup activities.
entry.content:
Summary

Repository maintenance with dependency constraint updates, compatibility fixes, and extensive issue cleanup.

Activity

  • Dependency constraint updates by Daniel Bünzli addressing Cmdliner 2.0.0 incompatibilities across multiple packages f87496e and adding fmt constraints on ocluster and acgtk packages 02c1d3c, 484fc9c
  • Package compatibility fixes including QuickJS support for OCaml 4.14 by David Sancho, ocamlfind 1.9.5 OCaml 5 compatibility updates, and opsian architecture validation improvements
  • Package maintenance with multiple elpi package constraint updates, ppxderivingqcheck compatibility fixes, and git/index library dependency adjustments
  • Issue cleanup effort closing 23 historical issues including conf-gmp installation problems, MSVC+Cygwin compilation issues, and macOS-specific build failures covering problems dating back to 2018-2024
entry.summary: Maintenance week with new package releases, dependency constraint updates, and repository cleanup activities.

entry.title: Week 10, 2025: Busy week with 22 new package releases and extensive maintenance metadata updates across ecosystem
entry.content:
Summary

Single new PR opened for conf-g++ OpenBSD support while extensive maintenance work added x-maintenance-intent metadata

Activity

  • New PR opened by José Nogueira for conf-g++ OpenBSD availability improvements (#27550)
  • Package maintenance metadata extensively updated by Hannes Mehnert adding x-maintenance-intent fields across 50+ packages including Mirage ecosystem, cryptographic libraries, and build tools
  • Cross-platform support improvements for Windows, OpenBSD, and FreeBSD configurations in conf-diffutils, conf-libevent, and various mingw packages
  • Package constraint updates applied to ensure compatibility with new ppxlib 0.36.0 release affecting multiple downstream packages
  • Cohttp 6.1.0 ecosystem release merged with lwt dependency fixes and async improvements
entry.summary: Busy week with 22 new package releases and extensive maintenance metadata updates across ecosystem

entry.title: Week 9, 2025: Major release week with 100+ package additions including diffast 0.1.1 diff analysis suite and extensive ecosystem updates
entry.content:
Summary

Extensive package maintenance with OPAM pre-release deprecation, ppxlib compatibility updates, and repository infrastructure improvements

Activity

  • Package maintenance sweep affecting 100+ packages with deprecation flags added to non-latest OPAM pre-releases (2.0.0~rc2 through 2.3.0~rc1) to encourage migration to stable versions (2ccd0b9)
  • PPX ecosystem updates preparing for ppxlib 0.36.0 compatibility across multiple PPX libraries including ppxexpect, ppxinlinetest, and ppxderiving family (ca7a9a1)
  • Library maintenance with version bumps for libbinaryen (116.0.0, 117.0.0, 118.0.0), duppy 0.9.5 streaming library, and various other ecosystem packages (8660939)
  • Infrastructure improvements including x-maintenance-intent field fixes for dune packages and configuration package typo corrections (991272d)
  • Archive package reintroduction with qinap 1.0 and base packages (base-bytes, base-num, base-ocamlbuild) restored to main repository (4a8995f)
entry.summary: Major release week with 100+ package additions including diffast 0.1.1 diff analysis suite and extensive ecosystem updates

entry.title: Week 8, 2025: Multiple new package releases including melange 5.0.1, git 3.18.0, and F* 2025.02.17, plus build compatibility fixes
entry.content:
Summary

Package maintenance focused on compatibility fixes and dependency updates across multiple library ecosystems

Activity

  • Package compatibility fixes across multiple libraries including PAF breaking changes requiring updates to 15+ dependent packages (5bba54c, 35196c4, d9e1aeb)
  • QCheck ecosystem updates with version 0.24 release requiring upper bounds adjustments across multiple packages to handle RNG distribution changes (55e71dc, af37ef99)
  • OCaml compiler fixes including 5.3.1 pointer correction and build system improvements for modern OCaml versions (c88fbc7, 0c3833e, 7f98f71)
  • Build system improvements addressing macOS ARM OpenMP issues and deadlock problems in older OCaml versions (af37ef9, 7f98f71)
  • Security and analysis tools with new BINSEC 0.10.0 binary analysis platform and Unisim ArchISec 0.0.10 architecture simulator (d0a11f7, b52920b)
entry.summary: Multiple new package releases including melange 5.0.1, git 3.18.0, and F* 2025.02.17, plus build compatibility fixes

entry.title: Week 7, 2025: Active week with 35+ new package releases, major DNS 10.0.0 ecosystem update, js_of_ocaml 6.0.1, and OCaml 5.2.1 Windows fix
entry.content:
Summary

Very active package maintenance week with 35+ new releases, dependency updates for major version changes, and ecosystem coordination

Activity

  • DNS ecosystem coordination by Hannes Mehnert delivering synchronized 10.0.0 release across 10 DNS packages including client libraries, server components, DNSSEC support, and certificate management (#27408)
  • JavaScript compilation improvements by @hhugo with jsofocaml 6.0.1 covering compiler, PPX extensions, toplevel support, and new WebAssembly compilation via wasmofocaml-compiler (#27402, #27403)
  • Mirage ecosystem updates by Hannes Mehnert including albatross 2.4.1 container management, mirage-qubes 2.0.0 Xen integration, memtrace-mirage 0.2.1.2.3 profiling, and logs-syslog 0.5.0 logging (#27418, #27419, #27421, #27422, #27424)
  • PPX ecosystem maintenance by @chetmurthy delivering pa_ppx 0.17 major upgrade with sexp deriver enhancements and pcre2 8.0.3 bugfix addressing build failures (#27444, #27452)
  • Melange development by Antonio Nuno Monteiro with releases 5.0.0-51 through 5.0.0-53 and reason 3.15.0 syntax improvements (#27414, #27415)
  • Dependency coordination across multiple packages addressing TCP/IP 9.0.0 breaking changes with upper bounds on dns-client and mirage-crypto-rng-mirage, and logs-syslog compatibility updates (#27423)
  • Formal methods tools additions including herdtools7 7.58 memory model analysis, visitors 20250212 AST traversal, and sel 0.6.0 specification language (#27432, #27433, #27434)
  • Functional libraries updates including fmlib 0.5.11 bugfix release across parsing, browser, and standard library components, and seqes 0.4 sequence processing (#27405)
entry.summary: Active week with 35+ new package releases, major DNS 10.0.0 ecosystem update, js_of_ocaml 6.0.1, and OCaml 5.2.1 Windows fix

entry.title: Week 6, 2025: Major MirageOS ecosystem updates with 40+ new package releases and CI infrastructure improvements
entry.content:
Summary

CI improvements focused on conf-package error handling plus extensive package maintenance and compatibility updates

Activity

  • CI infrastructure improvements discussed regarding error handling for conf-* packages (#27404, #27413) to reduce CI output clutter by Shon Feder and @zapashcanon
  • Package maintenance activities included OCaml 5.3 compatibility bounds added across multiple packages, dependency constraint updates for newer library versions, and configuration package improvements for cross-platform builds
  • Development workflow enhancements with CONTRIBUTING.md updates for dune-release integration (7c77950) and maintenance intent declarations for package ownership clarity
  • Release request for ocamlfind 1.9.8 by Jason Gross (#27373) indicating readiness for Windows compatibility improvements
entry.summary: Major MirageOS ecosystem updates with 40+ new package releases and CI infrastructure improvements

entry.title: Week 5, 2025: Major archive implementation phase 2 with thousands of legacy packages moved and multiple new package releases
entry.content:
Summary

Package maintenance with upper bounds updates, legacy compiler deprecation reversals, and audio library releases

Activity

  • Package maintenance updates including upper bounds for directories 0.6 dependencies (8630755b9a, 80d832f085, aa131f3eda), scfg revdeps bounds (0c5a47712304), and dependencies fixes (a99a9f19db)
  • Deprecation reversal for legacy compiler releases by Hannes Mehnert switching from deprecated flags to x-maintained status (cdd1e1d8c8, a9c9c9ac54, ed6eede884)
  • Audio and multimedia package releases with 16 packages from savonet including posix 2.2.0, xiph 1.0.0, and srt 0.3.3 (5ee5ec11912, 500c0c5f55, d9adececad)
  • OpenTelemetry 5-package release 0.11 by Marcello Seri (1619afdb9b)
  • Individual package releases including prelude 0.5 (a50ed53e54), benchmark 1.7 (a71a325649), dream-html 3.10.0 (38019caf8d), and patricia-tree 0.11.0 (705d7d4153)
entry.summary: Major archive implementation phase 2 with thousands of legacy packages moved and multiple new package releases

entry.title: Week 4, 2025: Active package release week with major library updates including Dune 3.17.2, odoc 3.0.0~beta1, and numerous OCurrent ecosystem packages
entry.content:
Summary

Extensive package maintenance with 60+ new package releases, dependency fixes, and ecosystem improvements across multiple domains

Activity

  • Major library ecosystem updates including Dune 3.17.2 build system release with 15 related packages, odoc 3.0.0~beta1 documentation generation improvements with 5 packages, and OCurrent 0.7.0 CI/CD framework update with 10 packages
  • Data processing and storage libraries saw updates with Carton 1.0.0 Git storage optimization (4 packages), Tar 3.2.0 archive handling improvements (4 packages), and SQLite3 5.3.0 database binding enhancements
  • Language bindings and protocol libraries received updates through ppxprotocolconv 5.2.2 (7 packages), POSIX bindings 2.1.0 (10 packages), and various smaller releases including SRT 0.3.2, pg_query 0.9.8, and ip2proxy 3.0.0
  • Development tooling improvements with utop 2.15.0-1 REPL fixes for OCaml 5.3.0, tezt 4.2.0 testing framework, landmarks 1.5 profiling tools (2 packages), and ocp-indent-nlfork 1.5.5 formatting tool
  • Package maintenance and compatibility fixes including coq-serapi upper bounds on ocamlfind for 14 package versions, git package dependency updates affecting 20+ versions, and various atdgen migration fixes to prevent build errors
  • Configuration and system packages with conf-mad.2 and conf-sysinfo.1 system dependency detection, host-arch package refinements for Windows-only deployment, and OCaml compiler version constraint additions
entry.summary: Active package release week with major library updates including Dune 3.17.2, odoc 3.0.0~beta1, and numerous OCurrent ecosystem packages

entry.title: Week 3, 2025: Maintenance intent metadata added to packages, new package releases, and issue discussions around build automation
entry.content:
Summary

Package submissions and maintenance with focus on dependency management and platform compatibility

Activity

  • Maintenance intent labeling initiative led by Hannes Mehnert with widespread addition of x-maintenance-intent fields to clarify package maintenance status (da383c86, 2559c1b9, 3e596f33)
  • Major package releases delivered including Coq 8.20.1 by @proux01 (6ed188dd), Merlin 5.4.1-503 (bc0f0a40), and 10 packages from savonet/ocaml-posix at 2.1.0 (bcbb0fde)
  • Dependency management improvements with lower bounds fixes for ctypes-foreign and architecture-specific compatibility updates (fad30962, 5e28de27)
  • Platform compatibility enhanced with FreeBSD support for conf-mad package and Windows constraints for Why3 packages (fb1b9733, 351b8a5d)
  • Governance updates with archiving policy refinements affecting package lifecycle management (fae92857, 22e2885c)
entry.summary: Maintenance intent metadata added to packages, new package releases, and issue discussions around build automation

entry.title: Week 2, 2025: Major OCaml 5.3.0 release, extensive package maintenance with x-maintenance-intent additions, and infrastructure improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Heavy package maintenance activity with new releases of core packages, maintenance intent declarations, and ecosystem updates

Activity

  • Major language release with OCaml 5.3.0 bringing latest compiler features and improvements
  • Maintenance intent declarations added across multiple package ecosystems including ctypes (aa2bd0b), erratique organization packages (cb7fddf), irmin (11da39a), and google APIs packages (f4051b2, 8e2a8a9, f79fdc8)
  • Core package updates including PPXLib 0.34.0, merlin 5.4-503 release across 4 packages (cfbca3f), LSP protocol packages with both 1.21.0 (bb3bf38) and 1.22.0 (d799102) releases
  • New package releases including linol 0.8 with 3 packages (a9279ec), multicore-magic 2.3.1 (66ac937), and Five Ortac packages 0.5.0 (c8c103e)
  • Infrastructure improvements with dependency regression fixes (5812c67, f3acb95) and platform-specific compatibility updates
entry.summary: Major OCaml 5.3.0 release, extensive package maintenance with x-maintenance-intent additions, and infrastructure improvements

entry.title: Week 1, 2025: Major archival process removing unavailable packages plus 6 new package additions including batteries 3.9.0 and OCaml 5.3 compatibility fixes
entry.content:
Summary

Major repository archival phase 1 removing 500+ unavailable packages, plus OCaml 5.3 compatibility fixes and package deprecation markings

Activity

  • Repository archival phase 1 completed by Hannes Mehnert removing all unavailable packages to clean up the repository (#27100, 1b4e0444)
  • OCaml 5.3 compatibility fixes implemented across multiple packages including riot, miou, and frama-c to handle effect keyword changes (cb391d60, d070e55f, 4c29abfa)
  • Package deprecation markings added for io-page-unix, tar-format, and functoria packages to signal maintenance status (069fc9e2, 28baa1c4, 53262a91)
  • Dependency constraint updates including result package availability restrictions for OCaml < 4.08 and owl-plplot upper bounds (c8565854, 98aa76ea)
  • Maintenance intent updates for arrayjit and neuralnetslib packages to indicate current development status (21bc7056)
  • Base-flambda package revival to support malfunction dependencies (f53a621b)
entry.summary: Major archival process removing unavailable packages plus 6 new package additions including batteries 3.9.0 and OCaml 5.3 compatibility fixes

entry.title: Week 52, 2024: Package releases dominated with new dream-html, junit, kdl, cachet, and infrastructure improvements for Windows support
entry.content:
Summary

Windows installation compatibility improvements and package maintenance updates across the ecosystem

Activity

  • Windows support improvements with Cygwin depext additions for conf-wget and ongoing Windows installation troubleshooting by Sita Ganesh (#27186, #27156)
  • Compiler deprecation maintenance with updated deprecation warnings across numerous OCaml base compiler and variant packages to improve ecosystem compatibility (9e88cb9)
  • Package ecosystem updates including compatibility fixes for morbig with OCaml >= 5.1, melange version updates, and various Tezos package maintenance (2677f32)
  • Infrastructure contributions by multiple maintainers including dependency management improvements and build system updates across the package collection
entry.summary: Package releases dominated with new dream-html, junit, kdl, cachet, and infrastructure improvements for Windows support

entry.title: Week 51, 2024: Major package maintenance effort addressing unavailable sources, OCaml 5.3.0 RC1 release, and numerous package updates
entry.content:
Summary

Extensive package maintenance addressing 40+ unavailable sources, compatibility fixes for OCaml 5.3, and maintenance intent declarations

Activity

  • Massive unavailable source cleanup by Hannes Mehnert marking 40+ packages as unavailable due to defunct gforge.inria.fr sources including dose, javalib, sawja, coccinelle, and proverif packages (11bf735, a398557, e5c4dd9)
  • Package revival effort updating 15+ packages to use opam-source-archive tarballs including mlpost, mysql, osdp, why, and zenon (a630bc8, 3f015dc)
  • OCaml 5.3 compatibility updates including melange version constraints (56a2bda), dream-httpaf fixes (2d648c5), and older PPX packages upper bounds
  • Maintenance intent declarations added by Hannes Mehnert for 20+ packages including DNS, crypto, and networking libraries (3e7d153) and @chetmurthy for camlp5 packages (b2fbdaf)
  • Package deprecation initiative marking unmaintained packages with deprecated flags including not-ocamlfind, patch, and http-client packages (397c614)
  • New package submissions including archetype 1.5.3 (7ea1f26), jose 0.10.0 with ARM32 restrictions (de6b008), and oidc 0.2.0 (ca3a859)
entry.summary: Major package maintenance effort addressing unavailable sources, OCaml 5.3.0 RC1 release, and numerous package updates

entry.title: Week 50, 2024: Package maintenance with new releases for Irmin 3.10.0, Mirage 4.8.2, and multiple package deprecations
entry.content:
Summary

Repository maintenance focused on OCaml 5.3 compatibility and package deprecation policy

Activity

  • OCaml 5.3 compatibility updates restricting packages that expect effect keyword as identifier including liquidsoap, guardian, archetype, and ezjs_d3pie (3487ffb0236ce0d40fcb8ad9f766a054aa10731c)
  • Package deprecation initiative replacing avoid-version flags with deprecated status for old Mirage packages, alt-ergo 2.5.0, apron 0.9.14, and beta releases (99ea256994ad296901fce98cebacc0238c68603b)
  • Constraint fixes for dependency specifications correcting malformed constraints and typos in package bounds (5910f1431da7e9c878277c96c315b9d8bb717642)
  • URL updates fixing broken download links for opam2web and pla packages (a7755d449fe1219e3ee5f36fe793c738ee4d0ecd)
  • Jsofocaml bounds preparation for 6.0.0 release across multiple dependent packages (06b26b35b029a02b891ff62f98c91d52ef9fc1b5)

entry.title: Week 49, 2024: Major repository governance framework introduced alongside extensive package releases and infrastructure improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Intensive week with major tool releases, liquidsoap ecosystem update, and extensive package publishing activity

Activity

  • Major tool releases including mdx 2.5.0 with enhanced documentation processing, odoc 2.4.4 with improved documentation generation, and elpi 2.0.5 with logic programming enhancements (c5f5893d, 3baeea74, ab5f8dff)
  • Comprehensive liquidsoap ecosystem update with 10 packages released covering core functionality, language support, and additional libraries for multimedia streaming (f51a0cfb)
  • Saturn 1.0.0 release delivering stable concurrent programming primitives and data structures (1be55c28)
  • jsofocaml 5.9.1 maintenance release with bug fixes and compatibility improvements (f38fcc2a)
  • Frama-C 30.0-Zinc release providing advanced static analysis capabilities (f432874b)
  • OCaml 5.2.1 compiler release with stability improvements and bug fixes (2c8aae5e)
  • Extensive package maintenance including dependency bound fixes, compiler compatibility updates, and Solo5 unikernel ecosystem improvements
entry.summary: Major repository governance framework introduced alongside extensive package releases and infrastructure improvements

entry.title: Week 48, 2024: Governance documentation added, major package releases for Dune 3.17.0, cohttp 6.0.0, eio 1.2, OCaml 5.3.0~beta2, and emergency fix for broken color package
entry.content:
Summary

Emergency response to broken color package, extensive cohttp 6.0 compatibility updates, major package releases, and modernization of build tools

Activity

  • Emergency package fix handled by Shon Feder reverting broken color.0.3.0 release that broke repository CI with parse errors (#26956, 23989dd)
  • cohttp 6.0.0 ecosystem migration with extensive compatibility updates across multiple packages by Anil Madhavapeddy and Marcello Seri including upper bounds for caldav, graphql-cohttp, websocket-async, and other HTTP-dependent packages (#26925, #26969, #26950)
  • Merlin editor support updated by Ulysse with versions 4.18-414 and 5.3-502 for different OCaml compiler compatibility (#26965)
  • Package deprecation initiative by Hannes Mehnert marking Solo5 and OCaml freestanding packages as deprecated while updating RML packages for OCaml 5 compatibility (#27001, #27000, #26997)
  • New package releases including postgresql 5.1.1, gsl 1.25.1, elpi 2.0.2-2.0.4, capnp-rpc 1.2.4, carbon 0.2.0, passage 0.1.5-0.1.6, and many others by various contributors
  • Archive URL updates by @hirrolot for mazeppa and checked_oint packages ensuring stable source availability (#26958, #26966)
entry.summary: Governance documentation added, major package releases for Dune 3.17.0, cohttp 6.0.0, eio 1.2, OCaml 5.3.0~beta2, and emergency fix for broken color package

entry.title: Week 47, 2024: Active week with 50+ package updates including OCaml 5.2.1, major cohttp 6.0.0 release, and new ecosystem packages
entry.content:
Summary

Extensive package maintenance with 50+ package releases, dependency constraint updates, and cross-platform compatibility improvements

Activity

  • New package releases included spawn v0.17.0 process spawning library, torch v0.17.1 machine learning bindings, typerep v0.17.1 type representation, and provider 0.0.11 dependency injection
  • Configuration package updates with new conf-libpcre.2 for Windows builds by Yosef, conf-capnproto.2 nixos support by Ryan Gibb, and homebrew directory detection improvements
  • Compatibility maintenance by Hannes Mehnert marking old mpp and glical releases unavailable, fixing broken URLs pointing to GitHub tarballs, and adding sources to opam-source-archives
  • JavaScript ecosystem preparation by @hhugo adding test dependencies for alcotest-js and constraints preparing jsofocaml 5.9 release
  • Version constraint adjustments by Anil Madhavapeddy including graphql-cohttp upper bounds, opentelemetry-cohttp-lwt constraints for cohttp 6+, and ldp_tls conflicts with cohttp 6+
  • OCaml compiler variants with new ocaml-variants.5.2.2+trunk and updated ocaml-variants.5.2.1+options packages
  • Security and reliability improvements with asyncssl patches, ppxlibjane.v0.17.1 disabled due to breakage, and re-enabled ppxbinprot and ppx_globalize on OCaml 5.3
entry.summary: Active week with 50+ package updates including OCaml 5.2.1, major cohttp 6.0.0 release, and new ecosystem packages

entry.title: Week 46, 2024: Package ecosystem maintenance with opam 2.3.0 release, macOS build fixes, and multiple new package releases
entry.content:
Summary

Repository maintenance focused on platform compatibility, package updates, and user support issues

Activity

  • macOS M2 installation support provided to John Hughes with dependency resolution for missing zstd library and complete installation workflow documentation (#26896)
  • Homebrew pkg-config deprecation addressed with pkgconf replacement affecting conf-pkg-config package for macOS users (#26876)
  • openSUSE SDL2 package naming issue reported by @dagala regarding outdated depext package names for conf-sdl2 family packages on Tumbleweed systems (#26900)
  • CI infrastructure discussion initiated by Hannes Mehnert regarding opam-repo-ci version alignment with system defaults for better developer environment matching (#26889)
entry.summary: Package ecosystem maintenance with opam 2.3.0 release, macOS build fixes, and multiple new package releases

entry.title: Week 45, 2024: Major OCaml 5.2.1 RC1 release alongside 20+ new package releases including PostgreSQL, Mirage, and web frameworks
entry.content:
Summary

Intense package ecosystem activity with 20+ new releases spanning compilers, web frameworks, formal verification, and cross-language tools

Activity

  • Compiler ecosystem activity centered on OCaml 5.2.1 RC1 release by Florian Angeletti with both base compiler and variants packages, plus preparation work for OCaml 5.3 compatibility (9313cf1, 753ba8b9)
  • Database and system integration improvements with PostgreSQL 5.1.0 release including new Windows MinGW support packages and libev Windows compatibility fixes (3b5e006c, 11ae3113)
  • Mirage ecosystem expansion with Solo5 0.9.4 unikernel updates and multiple HTTP client library releases for both Lwt and Mirage by Hannes Mehnert (376ea986, d609f723, dd5341c8)
  • Web development frameworks received major updates including Eliom 11.1.0 and Ocsigen Start 7.1.0 for modern web application development (3f7f2538, 484a3fa1)
  • Cross-language tooling enhanced with Rust integration through rust-staticlib-gen 0.2.1 three-package release and dune-cargo-build 0.2.1 for build system integration (1ee4de9c)
  • Formal verification tools expanded with bitwuzla-cxx 0.6.0 SMT solver bindings and various static analysis package updates (72a461cc)
  • Developer tools received updates including ocaml-version 3.7.0 for version management, topiary 0.5.1 for code formatting, and Unison 2.53.7 file synchronization (302daa08, b424f749, aeaaecf0)
  • Documentation and build system improvements including magic 0.7.4 release, various package constraint updates, and Cairo 2 graphics library updates (fad40c61, 9ffcb2c7)
entry.summary: Major OCaml 5.2.1 RC1 release alongside 20+ new package releases including PostgreSQL, Mirage, and web frameworks

entry.title: Week 44, 2024: Major package ecosystem expansion with TLS 1.0.4, multiple conf-mingw packages, and new multimedia libraries
entry.content:
Summary

Platform expansion initiatives with Windows/MinGW support and security-focused package maintenance

Activity

  • Windows ecosystem development with comprehensive MinGW support packages enabling cross-compilation for i686 and x86_64 Windows targets through curl, gnutls, and nettle integration (06fe46f, a44cce2, 2759c2a, 51e52d0)
  • Package compatibility improvements addressing platform-specific issues including Windows support fixes for lwt.5.8.0 (63cfa2d) and camlpdf Windows compatibility updates (9091d4f)
  • Core infrastructure maintenance with conf-gnutls and conf-libcurl updates enhancing system library detection and integration (d872638, 2de4b00)
  • Multimedia ecosystem expansion through coordinated releases of audio/video processing libraries supporting professional media workflows (4f12e87, 56a4a77, d31b2b9)
entry.summary: Major package ecosystem expansion with TLS 1.0.4, multiple conf-mingw packages, and new multimedia libraries

entry.title: Week 43, 2024: Busy week with 73 new package releases covering DNS tooling, machine learning libraries, static site generation, and package management improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Four new issues opened discussing user-space package installation strategies and build system compatibility questions

Activity

  • User-space installation discussion initiated by François Bérenger exploring strategies for installing system libraries like liblinear and libsvm without requiring system-wide installation (#26774, #26775)
  • Build system compatibility inquiry from Lilian Besson regarding opam variable behavior when switching to 32-bit OCaml variants (#26767)
  • Repository maintenance with one spam issue quickly closed by maintainers (#26784)
entry.summary: Busy week with 73 new package releases covering DNS tooling, machine learning libraries, static site generation, and package management improvements

entry.title: Week 42, 2024: Heavy week of package releases with 63 new packages added including major releases for YOCaml, opam 2.3.0 beta, and fixes for compiler installation issues
entry.content:
Summary

Repository maintenance focused on package submissions and bug report handling with 4 issues closed during the week

Activity

  • Package ecosystem expansion with 63 new package files added spanning diverse domains from static site generation to theorem proving and web frameworks
  • Issue resolution including #26701 lablgl OCaml 5.2 compatibility closed by 珊瑚, #26749 gitlab.inria.fr availability issue resolved by Mark Elvers, and compiler installation problems #26706 and #26686 closed with community support guidance
  • Infrastructure resilience demonstrated through quick resolution of external dependency issues affecting package installations
  • Compiler compatibility discussions ongoing with Daniel Bünzli addressing toplevel path configuration issues in #25819 and Tahina Ramananandro (professional account) reporting Cygwin python3 configuration challenges in #26434
entry.summary: Heavy week of package releases with 63 new packages added including major releases for YOCaml, opam 2.3.0 beta, and fixes for compiler installation issues

entry.title: Week 41, 2024: Package maintenance focused on OCaml 5.3 compatibility updates and new package submissions
entry.content: Activity report for ocaml/opam-repository - Week 41, 2024
entry.summary: Package maintenance focused on OCaml 5.3 compatibility updates and new package submissions
